meanings.definition: In poor condition due to age or neglect.
meanings.sent1: The shabbiest old chair in the room creaked when sat on.
meanings.sent2: The shabbiest house on the block needed a fresh coat of paint.
meanings.sent3: Even the shabbiest teddy bear can bring comfort to a child.
meanings.sent4: Her shabbiest memories were tucked away in a dusty corner of her mind.
meanings.sent5: The shabbiest book on the shelf held the most cherished stories.

meanings.sent1: The shabbiest toy in the store had missing parts.
meanings.sent2: His shabbiest attempt at painting still showed his creativity.
meanings.sent3: The shabbiest cake at the party was surprisingly delicious.
meanings.sent4: The shabbiest excuse for being late was that the dog ate the homework.
meanings.sent5: The shabbiest flower in the garden bloomed the brightest.

meanings.sent1: She felt embarrassed in her shabbiest dress at the fancy event.
meanings.sent2: The shabbiest beggar on the street had the kindest smile.
meanings.sent3: Even in his shabbiest attire, he carried himself with dignity.
meanings.sent4: The shabbiest scarf she owned was knitted by her grandmother.
meanings.sent5: His shabbiest shoes were his lucky pair for every game.
